metadata.title: CVE-2021-32551 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
It was discovered that read_file() in apport/hookutils.py would followsymbolic links or open FIFOs. When this function is used by the openjdk-15package apport hooks, it could expose private data to other local users.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32551` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
apport-gtk - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
apport-kde - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
apport-noui - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
apport-retrace - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
apport-valgrind - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
dh-apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
python3-apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
python3-problem-report - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.11-0ubuntu27.18').
